meanings.definition: A punctuation mark (;) used to separate independent clauses in a sentence.
meanings.sent1: I used semicolons to separate the clauses in my writing assignment.
meanings.sent2: She always remembers to use semicolons when writing complex sentences.
meanings.sent3: The semicolons at the party were the talk of the town, adding a touch of sophistication.
meanings.sent4: Her use of semicolons was like a bridge connecting two separate ideas in her essay.
meanings.sent5: The semicolons danced across the page, elegantly dividing the thoughts.

meanings.definition: A punctuation mark (;) used to separate items in a list when the items themselves contain commas.
meanings.sent1: The grocery list included fruits; apples, oranges, and bananas; and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: Remember to use semicolons when listing different categories; fruits, vegetables, and dairy.
meanings.sent3: The semicolons in the recipe made the ingredients look like they were having a party.
meanings.sent4: The semicolons acted as traffic lights, guiding the reader through the list smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Her use of semicolons in the list made each item stand out distinctly.
